member.name: T:AdoAsync.Abstractions.IDbExecutor
member.summary: Facade surface for executing database commands (async-only). Streaming is preferred; materialization is explicit. Not thread-safe; honor cancellation on all methods; retries/transactions are explicit.

member.name: M:AdoAsync.Abstractions.IDbExecutor.ExecuteScalarAsync``1(AdoAsync.CommandDefinition,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Executes a scalar command and returns the value converted to .

member.name: M:AdoAsync.Abstractions.IDbExecutor.QueryAsync``1(AdoAsync.CommandDefinition,System.Func{System.Data.IDataRecord,``0},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Streams rows and maps each record via the provided mapper.

member.name: M:AdoAsync.Abstractions.IDbExecutor.QueryTablesAsync(AdoAsync.CommandDefinition,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Executes a command and materializes results into tables (allocation-heavy).

member.name: M:AdoAsync.Abstractions.IDbExecutor.BulkImportAsync(AdoAsync.BulkImportRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Performs a bulk import into a destination table.

member.name: T:AdoAsync.Abstractions.IDbProvider
member.summary: Provider-specific factory and bindings. Contains no implementation logic here.

member.name: M:AdoAsync.Abstractions.IDbProvider.CreateCommand(System.Data.Common.DbConnection,AdoAsync.CommandDefinition)
member.summary: Creates a provider-specific command based on the definition.

member.name: M:AdoAsync.Abstractions.IDbProvider.ApplyParameters(System.Data.Common.DbCommand,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{AdoAsync.DbParameter})
member.summary: Applies parameters to a provider-specific command.

member.name: M:AdoAsync.Abstractions.IDbProvider.BulkImportAsync(System.Data.Common.DbConnection,AdoAsync.BulkImportRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Performs a provider-specific bulk import and returns the inserted row count.

member.name: M:AdoAsync.Abstractions.ITransactionManager.BeginAsync(System.Data.Common.DbConnection,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Begins a transaction on the provided open connection.

member.name: T:AdoAsync.BulkImportColumnMapping
member.summary: Maps a source column to a destination column for bulk import.

member.name: P:AdoAsync.BulkImportColumnMapping.SourceColumn
member.summary: Source column name in the reader.

member.name: P:AdoAsync.BulkImportColumnMapping.DestinationColumn
member.summary: Destination column name in the target table.

member.name: P:AdoAsync.BulkImportRequest.BatchSize
member.summary: Optional batch size for providers that support it.

member.name: P:AdoAsync.BulkImportRequest.AllowedDestinationTables
member.summary: Allow-list of destination tables (required for validation).

member.name: P:AdoAsync.BulkImportRequest.AllowedDestinationColumns
member.summary: Allow-list of destination columns (required when identifiers are supplied).

member.name: T:AdoAsync.BulkImportResult
member.summary: Result contract for bulk import operations.

member.name: T:AdoAsync.CommandDefinition
member.summary: Command definition for text and stored procedures. No execution logic lives here.

member.name: P:AdoAsync.CommandDefinition.CommandText
member.summary: SQL text or stored procedure name.

member.name: P:AdoAsync.CommandDefinition.CommandTimeoutSeconds
member.summary: Optional per-command timeout (seconds). If null, use default from options.

member.name: P:AdoAsync.CommandDefinition.Behavior
member.summary: For readers: use default streaming-friendly behavior unless caller overrides.

member.name: P:AdoAsync.CommandDefinition.AllowedStoredProcedures
member.summary: Allow-list of stored procedures permitted for execution. Required when using stored procedures.

member.name: P:AdoAsync.CommandDefinition.AllowedIdentifiers
member.summary: Allow-list of identifiers permitted for dynamic identifier usage (e.g., table names).

member.name: P:AdoAsync.CommandDefinition.IdentifiersToValidate
member.summary: Identifiers that will be used in the command and must be validated against .

member.name: T:AdoAsync.DbError
member.summary: Provider-agnostic error contract suitable for middleware and localization.

member.name: P:AdoAsync.DbError.IsTransient
member.summary: Indicates whether the error is considered transient.

member.name: P:AdoAsync.DbError.ProviderDetails
member.summary: Optional provider-specific details for diagnostics (never raw exceptions).

member.name: T:AdoAsync.DbErrorMapper
member.summary: Maps exceptions to the provider-agnostic DbError contract. Extend with provider-specific translations in provider namespaces.

member.name: M:AdoAsync.DbErrorMapper.Unknown(System.Exception)
member.summary: Returns an unknown error shape for the given exception.

member.name: M:AdoAsync.DbErrorMapper.Map(System.Exception,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Maps an exception, optionally overriding provider code/transience.

member.name: M:AdoAsync.DbErrorMapper.Validation(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Creates a validation error from message/parameters.

member.name: T:AdoAsync.DbOptions
member.summary: Provider-agnostic database options. Contains no logic or environment reads.

member.name: P:AdoAsync.DbOptions.ConnectionString
member.summary: Connection string for the chosen provider.

member.name: P:AdoAsync.DbOptions.RetryCount
member.summary: Retry count when retries are enabled.

member.name: P:AdoAsync.DbOptions.DataSource
member.summary: Optional provider data source; when set, connections are created from this data source instead of the raw connection string.

member.name: T:AdoAsync.DbParameter
member.summary: Database-agnostic parameter definition. Contains no execution logic.

member.name: P:AdoAsync.DbParameter.Name
member.summary: Parameter name (include prefix as required by provider).

member.name: P:AdoAsync.DbParameter.Size
member.summary: Size is mandatory for output string/binary parameters and encouraged for variable-length inputs when known.

member.name: T:AdoAsync.DbResult
member.summary: Result envelope for command execution. Supports scalar, materialized tables, output parameters, duration, retry count, and errors.

member.name: P:AdoAsync.DbResult.OutputParameters
member.summary: Output parameter values keyed by name.

member.name: T:AdoAsync.Execution.DbExecutor
member.summary: Orchestrates validation → resilience → provider → ADO.NET. Not thread-safe. Streaming by default; materialization is explicit and allocation-heavy. Retries are Polly-based and opt-in; cancellation is honored on all async calls; transactions are explicit via the transaction manager.

member.name: M:AdoAsync.Execution.DbExecutor.Create(AdoAsync.DbOptions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new executor for the specified options.

member.name: T:AdoAsync.IdentifierWhitelist
member.summary: Helper to enforce allow-list rules for stored procedure names and identifiers. Caller is responsible for supplying controlled allow lists.

member.name: M:AdoAsync.IdentifierWhitelist.EnsureStoredProcedureAllowed(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlySet{System.String})
member.summary: Throws if the stored procedure is not in the allow-list.

member.name: M:AdoAsync.IdentifierWhitelist.EnsureIdentifierAllowed(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlySet{System.String})
member.summary: Throws if the identifier is not in the allow-list.

member.name: M:AdoAsync.IdentifierWhitelist.EnsureIdentifiersAllowed(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlySet{System.String})
member.summary: Throws if any identifier in the sequence is not in the allow-list.

member.summary: Builds Polly retry policies based on DbOptions. No hidden retries.

member.summary: Creates a retry policy from options and transient predicate; disabled for user transactions.

member.summary: Handle wrapper to expose the active transaction and ensure rollback-on-dispose.

member.summary: Disposes the transaction, rolling back if not committed.

member.summary: Explicit transaction manager (Approach A) with rollback-on-dispose semantics.
